post: Here is a small thing I have been practicing to reduce a tiny bit my paper waste. post: Skuffle Wammer, my 5 minute war game:Place toy soldiers within 20x20 cm play area. Place 3d6 by each soldier.On soldier's turn, move or attack.To attack: remove 1d6 from a soldier's dice pool and roll. post: I'm happy with this: An emulated classic (24-bit 68K) Mac with 5MB of RAM. No original classic Mac had >4MB of RAM as the ROM got in the way (*). I've patched the ROM & System 6 to support a relocated ROM. The main constraint on increasing RAM to e.g. 15MB is now the memory-mapped I/O, which also needs relocation. The eventual goal is a physical large-memory classic Mac.(*) The Mac Portable's ROM location allows up to 9MB of RAM, but it's a bit weird, and I'm going for the full 15+MB.

post: Despite local follow fraction being clearly related to the instance's target audience, I'm still interested in any correlation between instance size (∝ the fraction of the Fediverse they represent), so I plotted follow fraction against weekly instance logins.The fit's poor, but we can see interesting outliers - it turns out that mastodon.social has a *low* fraction of local follows considering its size! As mentioned previously, non-English instances have high local follow counts.

post: #astronomie vu la météo c'est le bon moment pour analyser les images de la #comète #C2023A3 #Tsuchinshan faites jeudi. Avec #Siril on peut facilement calculer le flux des objets dans le champ de l'image donc en comparant les étoiles connues avec la comète déduire sa magnitude.
